# Graffiti CSS Framework

> A minimal CSS framework with fluid typography, responsive layouts, and utility classes

## Package Structure

The framework is split into two entry points for optimal bundle size:
- **Main CSS** (`@drop-in/graffiti`): Core framework with typography, layouts, and utilities
- **Decks CSS** (`@drop-in/graffiti/decks`): Optional styles for `@drop-in/decks` components (accordion, dialog, drawer, menu, toast)

Import only what you need:
```js
import '@drop-in/graffiti'        // Base framework
import '@drop-in/graffiti/decks'  // Optional decks components
```

## CSS Variables

### Typography & Fluid System
- `--fl`: Fluid level (-1 to 6) - Set on elements to control fluid typography scale
- `--font-sans`: System font stack
- `--font-size-min`: 14px (minimum font size)
- `--font-size-max`: 18px (maximum font size)
- `--font-ratio-min`: 1.2 (modular scale ratio for small screens)
- `--font-ratio-max`: 1.33 (modular scale ratio for large screens)
- `--variable-unit`: 100vi (viewport inline) or 100cqi (container query inline) when using `.fc`

### Spacing
- `--vs-s`: 0.5rem (vertical spacing small)
- `--vs-base`: 1rem (vertical spacing base)
- `--vs-m`: 1.5rem (vertical spacing medium)
- `--vs-l`: 2rem (vertical spacing large)
- `--vs-xl`: 4rem (vertical spacing extra large)

### Border Radius
- `--br-xs`: 2px
- `--br-s`: 4px
- `--br-m`: 8px
- `--br-l`: 16px
- `--br-xl`: 24px
- `--br-xxl`: 32px

### Borders
- `--border-05`: solid 1px var(--fg-05) (subtle border)
- `--border-1`: solid 1px var(--fg-2) (thin border)
- `--border-2`: solid 2px var(--fg-2) (thicker border)

### Padding
- `--pad-xs`: 0.25rem
- `--pad-s`: 0.5rem
- `--pad-m`: 0.75rem
- `--pad-l`: 1rem
- `--pad-xl`: 1.5rem
- `--pad-xxl`: 2rem
- `--pad-xxxl`: 4rem

### Shadows
Layered, adaptive shadows (deeper in dark mode):
- `--shadow-1`: Subtle shadow
- `--shadow-2`: Light lift
- `--shadow-3`: Moderate depth
- `--shadow-4`: Strong elevation
- `--shadow-5`: Dramatic shadow
- `--shadow-6`: Maximum depth
- `--box`: Inset highlights with subtle shadow

### Line Heights
- `--lh-xs`: 1 (extra tight, single line height)
- `--lh-s`: 1.2 (tight line height for headings/display text)
- `--lh`: 1.5 (default for body text)
- `--lh-m`: var(--lh) (alias for default)
- `--lh-l`: 1.8 (extra space for large body text)
- `--lh-xl`: 2 (very loose, double line height)

### Easing Functions
Modern `linear()` based easing functions:
- `--ease-smooth`: Smooth acceleration/deceleration
- `--ease-bounce`: Bouncy spring-like motion
- `--ease-emphasized`: Emphasized material design easing

### Semantic Colors
- `--primary`: var(--blue) - Primary action color
- `--error`: var(--red) - Error/danger color
- `--warning`: var(--yellow) - Warning color
- `--success`: var(--green) - Success color

### Input Styling
- `--input-shadow`: Complex shadow for form inputs (inset highlights + depth)

### Colors (OKLCH)
Perceptually uniform OKLCH color space with automatic 1-9 scales generated via relative color syntax.
Scale 9 is the base color at full opacity. Lower numbers are more transparent (10% to 90% opacity).

#### Yellow
- `--yellow` (scale 9): oklch(0.88 0.15 95) - Base yellow
- `--yellow-1` through `--yellow-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Amber
- `--amber` (scale 9): oklch(0.78 0.16 80) - Base amber
- `--amber-1` through `--amber-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Orange
- `--orange` (scale 9): oklch(0.75 0.18 65) - Base orange
- `--orange-1` through `--orange-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Red
- `--red` (scale 9): oklch(0.62 0.22 35) - Base red
- `--red-1` through `--red-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Pink
- `--pink` (scale 9): oklch(0.62 0.25 350) - Base pink
- `--pink-1` through `--pink-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Purple
- `--purple` (scale 9): oklch(0.65 0.24 310) - Base purple
- `--purple-1` through `--purple-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Indigo
- `--indigo` (scale 9): oklch(0.55 0.25 275) - Base indigo
- `--indigo-1` through `--indigo-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Blue
- `--blue` (scale 9): oklch(0.5 0.28 270) - Base blue
- `--blue-1` through `--blue-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Teal
- `--teal` (scale 9): oklch(0.82 0.08 185) - Base teal
- `--teal-1` through `--teal-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Green
- `--green` (scale 9): oklch(0.72 0.18 165) - Base green
- `--green-1` through `--green-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Lime
- `--lime` (scale 9): oklch(0.80 0.16 130) - Base lime
- `--lime-1` through `--lime-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Highlighter
- `--highlighter` (scale 9): oklch(0.88 0.22 115) - Base highlighter (bright tennis ball green)
- `--highlighter-1` through `--highlighter-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Brown
- `--brown` (scale 9): oklch(0.55 0.12 60) - Base brown
- `--brown-1` through `--brown-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Neutral Gray
- `--gray` (scale 9): oklch(0.5 0.02 270) - Base gray
- `--gray-1` through `--gray-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### Slate
- `--slate` (scale 9): oklch(0.52 0.04 255) - Base slate
- `--slate-1` through `--slate-9`: Full scale from most transparent to full opacity

#### White (Static)
- `--white`: oklch(1 0 0) - Pure white
- `--white-1` through `--white-9`: Full scale from most transparent to opaque

#### Black (Static)
- `--black`: oklch(0 0 0) - Pure black
- `--black-1` through `--black-9`: Full scale from most transparent to opaque

> **Note:** `--white` and `--black` are static colors that do NOT change with light/dark mode. In most cases, you should prefer `--fg` and `--bg` which automatically adapt to the user's color scheme. Only use `--white`/`--black` when you explicitly need a color that stays constant regardless of light/dark mode (e.g., text on a colored button background).

### Theming (light-dark mode)
- `--fg`: Foreground color (auto switches: black in light, white in dark)
- `--bg`: Background color (auto switches: white in light, black in dark)

#### Foreground Scale
Contrasting shades that automatically adapt to light/dark mode. Great for borders, subtle backgrounds, and text emphasis.
- `--fg-05`: 5% foreground opacity
- `--fg-1` through `--fg-9`: Full scale from most transparent to opaque

#### Background Scale
Contrasting tints that automatically adapt to light/dark mode. Useful for layered surfaces and subtle overlays.
- `--bg-05`: 5% background opacity
- `--bg-1` through `--bg-9`: Full scale from most transparent to opaque

### Layout Customization
- `--gap`: Default gap for layout utilities (default: varies per layout)
- `--layout-gap`: Override gap for specific layout (non-inheriting - does not cascade to nested layouts)
- `--min-card-width`: Minimum card width for `.layout-card` (default: 290px)
- `--layout-min-card-width`: Override for specific card layout
- `--max-width`: Max width for `.layout-readable` (default: 1200px)
- `--layout-max-width`: Override for specific readable layout
- `--padding`: Inline padding for `.layout-readable` (default: 2rem)
- `--layout-padding`: Override for specific readable layout

## Typography Classes

### Font Size Utilities
- `.fs-xs`: Extra small (--fl: -1)
- `.fs-base`: Base size (--fl: 0)
- `.fs-s`: Small heading (--fl: 1)
- `.fs-m`: Medium heading (--fl: 2)
- `.fs-l`: Large heading (--fl: 3)
- `.fs-xl`: Extra large (--fl: 4)
- `.fs-xxl`: Double extra large (--fl: 5)
- `.fs-xxxl`: Triple extra large (--fl: 6)
- `.pull-quote`: Styled pull quote text (--fl: 2)

### Heading Classes
- `.h1` through `.h6`: Apply heading styles to non-heading elements

### Fluid Typography
- `.fc` or `.fluid-text-container`: Makes typography responsive to container width instead of viewport (uses container queries)

## Layout Classes

**Note:** All layout classes include DEFAULT properties (display, grid-template-columns, gap, responsive behavior, etc.). DO NOT add these in your code - they are redundant. Only add custom CSS variables when specifically needed.

### `.layout-card`
Auto-fill responsive card grid
```css
/* Usage */
<div class="layout-card">
  <div>Card 1</div>
  <div>Card 2</div>
</div>

/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: grid */
/* - grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(290px, 1fr)) */
/* - gap: 2rem (default gap) */
/* - Automatically responsive, no media queries needed */

/* Customize only if needed */
<div class="layout-card" style="--min-card-width: 250px; --gap: 1rem;">
```

### `.layout-sidebar`
Sidebar + main content (default: 250px sidebar)
```css
/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: grid */
/* - grid-template-columns: 250px 1fr (or variant) */
/* - gap: 2rem (default gap) */
/* - align-items: start */
/* - Automatically stacks to single column on mobile (<768px) */

/* Variants */
.layout-sidebar          /* 250px sidebar */
.layout-sidebar.narrow   /* 150px sidebar */
.layout-sidebar.wide     /* 350px sidebar */
.layout-sidebar.invert   /* Sidebar on right */
.layout-sidebar.fill     /* Full-height sidebar for app shells */
```

### `.layout-sidebar.fill`
Full-height sidebar variant for app shell layouts. Sidebar stretches to fill the container height with independent scrolling.
```css
/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - align-items: stretch (overrides default start) */
/* - First child gets overflow-y: auto for independent scrolling */

/* Usage - App shell with sidebar navigation */
<div class="layout-sidebar fill" style="--layout-gap: 0">
  <aside class="split vertical">
    <nav>Top navigation</nav>
    <div>Bottom footer/promo</div>
  </aside>
  <main>Main content</main>
</div>
```

### `.layout-split`
50/50 two-column layout
```css
/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: grid */
/* - grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr */
/* - gap: 2rem (default gap) */
/* - align-items: start */
/* - Automatically stacks to single column on mobile (<768px) unless .no-stack */

/* Variants */
.layout-split           /* Stacks on mobile */
.layout-split.no-stack  /* Stays side-by-side on mobile */
```

### `.layout-three-col`
Three equal columns
```css
/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: grid */
/* - grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr */
/* - gap: 2rem (default gap) */
/* - align-items: start */

/* Responsive breakpoints (automatic, do not add media queries): */
/* 3 columns on desktop (≥1024px) */
/* 2 columns on tablet (≥768px and <1024px) */
/* 1 column on mobile (<768px) */
```

### `.layout-readable`
Max-width container for optimal readability
```css
/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - width: 100% */
/* - max-width: 1200px (default, customize with --max-width) */
/* - padding-inline: 2rem (default, customize with --padding) */

/* Variants */
.layout-readable        /* Start-aligned (default) */
.layout-readable.center /* Centered (adds margin-inline: auto) */
.layout-readable.end    /* End-aligned (adds margin-inline-start: auto) */

/* Child utility */
.full-bleed             /* Breaks out of container to full viewport width */
```

### `.layout-holy-grail`
Three-column layout: sidebar + content + sidebar
```css
/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: grid */
/* - grid-template-columns: auto 1fr auto */
/* - gap: 2rem (default gap) */
/* - Automatically stacks to single column on mobile (<768px) */

/* Usage */
<div class="layout-holy-grail">
  <div style="width: 200px">Left sidebar</div>
  <div>Main content</div>
  <div style="width: 200px">Right sidebar</div>
</div>
```

### `.stack`
Vertical flexbox with gap
```css
/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: flex */
/* - flex-direction: column */
/* - gap: 1rem (default gap) */
/* - justify-content: flex-start */
/* - Resets all child margins to 0 */

/* Customize gap only if needed */
<div class="stack" style="--gap: 2rem;">
```

### `.cluster`
Horizontal wrapping flexbox layout, perfect for tags, pills, and breadcrumbs
```css
/* Usage */
<div class="cluster">
  <span>Tag 1</span>
  <span>Tag 2</span>
  <span>Tag 3</span>
</div>

/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: flex */
/* - flex-wrap: wrap (wrapping is automatic) */
/* - gap: 1rem (default gap) */
/* - align-items: center */

/* Customize gap only if needed */
<div class="cluster" style="--gap: 0.5rem;">
```

### `.carousel`
Horizontal scrolling with CSS scroll-snap (no JavaScript required)
```css
/* Usage */
<div class="carousel">
  <div>Slide 1</div>
  <div>Slide 2</div>
  <div>Slide 3</div>
</div>

/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: flex */
/* - gap: 1rem (default gap) */
/* - overflow-x: auto */
/* - scroll-snap-type: x mandatory */
/* - scroll-padding-inline: 1rem */
/* - scrollbar-width: thin */
/* - Children have: scroll-snap-align: start, flex-shrink: 0 */
```

### `.reel`
Vertical scrolling with CSS scroll-snap (no JavaScript required)
```css
/* Usage */
<div class="reel" style="--reel-height: 400px">
  <div>Panel 1</div>
  <div>Panel 2</div>
  <div>Panel 3</div>
</div>

/* DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add): */
/* - display: flex */
/* - flex-direction: column */
/* - gap: 1rem (default gap) */
/* - overflow-y: auto */
/* - scroll-snap-type: y mandatory */
/* - scroll-padding-block: 1rem */
/* - scrollbar-width: thin */
/* - max-height: 80vh (default, customize with --reel-height) */
/* - Children have: scroll-snap-align: start, flex-shrink: 0 */
```

## Utility Classes

**Note:** Each utility class includes DEFAULT properties. DO NOT add these in your code - they are redundant. Only customize when specifically needed.

### Display & Layout
- `.flex`: Display flex with 20px gap
  - **DEFAULT**: `display: flex`, `gap: 20px` (do not add these)
- `.grid`: Display grid with 1rem gap (customize with `--gap`)
  - **DEFAULT**: `display: grid`, `gap: 1rem` (do not add these)
- `.split`: Flex layout with space-between and top alignment
  - **DEFAULT**: `display: flex`, `gap: 20px`, `align-items: start`, `justify-content: space-between` (do not add these)
- `.split.vertical`: Vertical split - first child at top, last child at bottom
  - **DEFAULT**: `flex-direction: column`, `height: 100%` (do not add these)
  - Useful for sidebar layouts with nav at top and footer/promo at bottom
- `.readable`: Max-width 900px container
  - **DEFAULT**: `max-width: 900px`, `width: 100%` (do not add these)

### List Utilities
- `.no-list`: Remove list styling (margin, padding, list-style)

### Spacing
- `.row`: Add vertical margin (--vs-m)

### Visibility
- `.visually-hidden`: Hide element visually but keep accessible to screen readers

### Shape
- `.circle`: Circular element (default --size: 40px)

### Box Styles
- `.box`: Basic box with tint background, padding, border radius, and border
- `.box.ghost`: Transparent background with border (outline style)
- `.box.glow`: Box with subtle inset glow shadow
- `.box.semi-gloss`: Gradient background with stronger shadow (premium feel)
- `.box.invisible`: Transparent background with no border or shadow

### Avatar
Circular avatar for user images or initials:
- `.avatar`: Base avatar (default size: 2.5rem)

**Size Variants:**
- `.avatar.xs`: Extra small (1.5rem)
- `.avatar.s`: Small (2rem)
- `.avatar`: Medium/default (2.5rem)
- `.avatar.l`: Large (3.5rem)
- `.avatar.xl`: Extra large (5rem)

**Modifiers:**
- `.avatar.bordered`: Adds subtle border

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- Circular shape (border-radius: 50%)
- Images automatically use object-fit: cover
- Subtle background color for initials fallback (--fg-1)
- Fluid typography for initials that scales with size

Usage:
```html
<!-- With image -->
<span class="avatar">
  <img src="user.jpg" alt="User name">
</span>

<!-- With initials (fallback) -->
<span class="avatar">JD</span>

<!-- Size variants -->
<span class="avatar xs"><img src="user.jpg" alt=""></span>
<span class="avatar s"><img src="user.jpg" alt=""></span>
<span class="avatar"><img src="user.jpg" alt=""></span>
<span class="avatar l"><img src="user.jpg" alt=""></span>
<span class="avatar xl"><img src="user.jpg" alt=""></span>

<!-- With border -->
<span class="avatar bordered">
  <img src="user.jpg" alt="User name">
</span>
```

### Callout
Informational callout boxes with multiple variants for different message types:
- `.callout`: Base callout with blue styling (default info state)
- `.callout.warning`: Yellow warning callout
- `.callout.error`: Red error callout
- `.callout.success`: Green success callout
- `.callout.ghost`: Neutral gray callout
- `.callout.hard`: Adds thick left border accent (can combine with other variants)

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- `display: flex`
- `flex-direction: column`
- `justify-content: flex-start`
- `gap: 1rem` (default, inherits from `--layout-gap` or `--gap`)
- `padding: var(--pad-l)`
- `border-radius: var(--br-m)`
- `border: 1px solid`
- Resets all child margins to 0

**Customization (only if needed):**
- `--callout-color`: Background color (default: var(--blue-1))
- `--callout-border-color`: Border color (default: var(--blue-5))
- `--gap`: Customize gap between children

Usage:
```html
<div class="callout">
  <h3>Information</h3>
  <p>This is an informational message.</p>
</div>

<div class="callout warning hard">
  <h3>Warning</h3>
  <p>Please be careful!</p>
</div>
```

### Button
Styled buttons and button-like elements with multiple variants:
- `button` or `.button`: Base button styling

**Variants:**
- `.primary`: Blue primary action button
- `.success`: Green success button
- `.warning`: Yellow warning button  
- `.error`: Red error/danger button
- `.ghost`: Transparent with border outline
- `.minimal`: No background or border, just text
- `.mini`: Smaller padding for compact buttons

**Customization:**
- `--button-color`: Override base button background color

Usage:
```html
<button>Default</button>
<button class="primary">Primary Action</button>
<button class="ghost">Ghost Button</button>
<a href="#" class="button minimal">Link as Button</a>
```

### Table
Responsive table wrapper with clean styling for data tables:
- `.table`: Wrapper class for tables (adds overflow-x, border, and border-radius)

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- `overflow-x: auto` (horizontal scrolling on small screens)
- `border: var(--border-2)` (2px solid border)
- `border-radius: var(--table-border, var(--br-m))` (medium border radius)
- `table`: 100% width, border-collapse
- `td, th`: Left-aligned text, padding with `var(--pad-m)` and `var(--vs-base)`
- `thead`: Bottom border separator
- `td`: Bottom border on all rows except last

**Customization (only if needed):**
- `--table-border`: Custom border-radius for the wrapper

Usage:
```html
<div class="table">
  <table>
    <thead>
      <tr>
        <th>Header 1</th>
        <th>Header 2</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
      <tr>
        <td>Data 1</td>
        <td>Data 2</td>
      </tr>
    </tbody>
  </table>
</div>
```

### Breadcrumbs
Simple breadcrumb navigation with customizable separators:
- `.breadcrumbs`: Navigation component for showing hierarchy trail

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- Flexbox layout with wrapping
- Slash (/) separators between items via `::before` pseudo-elements
- Links styled with muted color (`--fg-5`) that brightens on hover (`--fg-7`)
- Current page indicator via `[aria-current="page"]` on the `<li>`
- Proper focus-visible states for accessibility

**Customization (only if needed):**
- `--separator`: Custom separator character (default: "/")

Usage:
```html
<!-- Default slash separator -->
<nav class="breadcrumbs" aria-label="Breadcrumb">
  <ul class="no-list">
    <li><a href="/">Home</a></li>
    <li><a href="/products">Products</a></li>
    <li aria-current="page">Current Page</li>
  </ul>
</nav>

<!-- Custom separator -->
<nav class="breadcrumbs" style="--separator: '›'" aria-label="Breadcrumb">
  <ul class="no-list">
    <li><a href="/">Home</a></li>
    <li aria-current="page">About</li>
  </ul>
</nav>
```

### Dropdown Menu
Native dropdown menu using HTML popover API and CSS anchor positioning:
- `.dropdown`: Container for dropdown trigger and menu
- `.dropdown-menu[popover]`: The popover menu element

**Variants:**
- `.dropdown.end`: Menu aligns to the end (right) of the trigger button

**Child Elements (optional):**
- `.dropdown-header`: Section header within menu (muted text)
- `a` and `button` elements are automatically styled as menu items (no class needed)
- `hr` elements are automatically styled as dividers (no class needed)

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- No JavaScript required for open/close (uses HTML popover API)
- CSS anchor positioning for automatic placement below trigger
- Smooth open/close animations with scale and opacity
- Links and buttons inside menu get hover, focus, and active states automatically
- Disabled state support via `[aria-disabled="true"]` or `.disabled`

Usage:
```html
<!-- Basic dropdown -->
<div class="dropdown">
  <button popovertarget="menu-id">Options</button>
  <div id="menu-id" popover class="dropdown-menu">
    <div class="dropdown-header">Account</div>
    <hr>
    <a href="/profile">Profile</a>
    <a href="/settings">Settings</a>
    <hr>
    <button>Sign Out</button>
  </div>
</div>

<!-- End-aligned dropdown -->
<div class="dropdown end">
  <button popovertarget="actions-menu">Actions</button>
  <div id="actions-menu" popover class="dropdown-menu">
    <a href="#edit">Edit</a>
    <a href="#delete">Delete</a>
  </div>
</div>
```

### Header
Full-width site header with navigation support:
- `.header`: Base header layout (full-width, flex, space-between)

**Variants:**
- `.header.border`: Adds bottom border
- `.header.sticky`: Sticks to top when scrolling

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- Full viewport width with negative margin trick
- Flexbox layout with space-between
- All direct children have margin reset to 0
- Nav ul styled as horizontal flex list

Usage:
```html
<header class="header border sticky">
  <h1>Logo</h1>
  <nav>
    <ul>
      <li><a href="/">Home</a></li>
      <li><a href="/about">About</a></li>
    </ul>
  </nav>
</header>
```

### Details/Accordion
Native HTML disclosure element with smooth animations:
- `details` and `summary`: Base accordion styling with animated open/close

**Variants:**
- `details.bordered`: Bordered container with rounded corners
- `details.right` or `summary.right`: Arrow indicator on right side
- `details.minimal`: Minimal style with +/− toggle

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- Smooth height animation using `@starting-style` and `allow-discrete`
- Custom `›` arrow indicator that rotates on open
- Proper focus-visible states
- Content padding and margin reset

Usage:
```html
<details>
  <summary>Click to expand</summary>
  <p>Hidden content here</p>
</details>

<details class="bordered">
  <summary>Bordered variant</summary>
  <p>Content with border container</p>
</details>

<details class="minimal">
  <summary>FAQ Question</summary>
  <p>Answer with +/− toggle</p>
</details>
```

### Swipe
Horizontal swipe-to-reveal component using CSS scroll-snap:
- `.swipe`: Base swipe container with left and right action areas

**Variants:**
- `.swipe.stop`: Stays in "open" position after swipe
- `.swipe.full-bleed`: Extends to full viewport width

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- CSS scroll-snap for smooth snapping
- Container query for center content width
- Hidden scrollbar
- Three-column grid (action | content | action)

Usage:
```html
<div class="swipe stop">
  <button>Delete</button>
  <div>Swipeable content</div>
  <button>Archive</button>
</div>
```

### Aspect Ratio Utilities
Maintain specific aspect ratios for containers (useful for images, videos, cards):
- `.aspect-square`: 1:1 aspect ratio
- `.aspect-video`: 16:9 aspect ratio (standard video)
- `.aspect-4-3`: 4:3 aspect ratio (classic TV)
- `.aspect-21-9`: 21:9 aspect ratio (ultrawide)
- Custom: Use `aspect-ratio: var(--aspect-ratio)` or `aspect-ratio: 2 / 1`

### Form Validation States
Built-in styles for form inputs and messages:
- `.error`: Red border/color for error state (inputs and text)
- `.success`: Green border/color for success state (inputs and text)
- `.warning`: Orange border/color for warning state (inputs and text)

Usage:
```html
<input class="error" />
<small class="error">Error message</small>

<input class="success" />
<small class="success">Success message</small>

<input class="warning" />
<small class="warning">Warning message</small>
```

### Toggle Switch
Accessible toggle/switch input using native checkbox:
- `input[type="checkbox"].toggle`: Toggle switch styling

**Variants:**
- `.toggle.compact`: Smaller toggle size

**Customization:**
- `--toggle-color`: Color when checked (default: var(--primary))
- `--toggle-width`: Toggle track width
- `--toggle-height`: Toggle track height

**DEFAULT PROPERTIES (already included, do not add):**
- Smooth transition animations
- Proper focus-visible outline
- Disabled state styling
- Knob slides on check/uncheck

Usage:
```html
<input type="checkbox" class="toggle" />
<input type="checkbox" class="toggle" checked />
<input type="checkbox" class="toggle compact" />

<label>
  <input type="checkbox" class="toggle" />
  Enable notifications
</label>
```

### Auto-Color
Automatically sets text color (light or dark) based on background luminosity:
- `.auto-color`: Applies automatic contrast text color

**Variants:**
- `.auto-color.chroma`: Adds 80% opacity for subtle tinted text effect

**Customization:**
- `--bg-color`: The background color to analyze (required)
- `--threshold`: Lightness cutoff for switching (default: 0.6)

Usage:
```html
<div class="auto-color" style="--bg-color: var(--blue-5)">
  Text automatically becomes white
</div>
<div class="auto-color" style="--bg-color: var(--yellow-3)">
  Text automatically becomes black
</div>
```

## How It Works

### Fluid Typography System
Graffiti uses a custom fluid typography system based on the `--fl` (fluid level) variable:

1. Set `--fl` on any element (-1 to 6)
2. Font size automatically scales between viewport min/max
3. Uses `clamp()`, `pow()`, and modular scale ratios
4. All text elements inherit fluid sizing

Example:
```css
.custom-text {
  --fl: 3; /* Will scale like an h3 */
}
```

### Container-Based Fluid Typography
Add `.fc` to a container to make child typography responsive to container width instead of viewport:
```html
<div class="fc">
  <h1>Scales with container, not viewport</h1>
</div>
```

### OKLCH Color System
Graffiti uses the OKLCH color space for perceptually uniform colors:

**Why OKLCH?**
- Perceptually uniform: Equal numeric changes = equal visual changes
- Wide color gamut support (P3 displays)
- Better interpolation than RGB/HSL
- Predictable lightness adjustments

**Automatic Color Scales**
Each color has a 1-9 scale generated using opacity-based relative color syntax:
```css
/* Base color (scale 9 = full opacity) */
--yellow: oklch(0.88 0.15 95);

/* Opacity-based scale */
--yellow-1: oklch(from var(--yellow) l c h / 0.1);  /* 10% opacity */
--yellow-2: oklch(from var(--yellow) l c h / 0.2);  /* 20% opacity */
--yellow-3: oklch(from var(--yellow) l c h / 0.3);  /* 30% opacity */
--yellow-4: oklch(from var(--yellow) l c h / 0.4);  /* 40% opacity */
--yellow-5: oklch(from var(--yellow) l c h / 0.5);  /* 50% opacity */
--yellow-6: oklch(from var(--yellow) l c h / 0.6);  /* 60% opacity */
--yellow-7: oklch(from var(--yellow) l c h / 0.75); /* 75% opacity */
--yellow-8: oklch(from var(--yellow) l c h / 0.9);  /* 90% opacity */
--yellow-9: var(--yellow);                          /* 100% opacity (base) */
```

Scale 9 is always the base color at full opacity. Lower numbers are more transparent.

### Theming
Uses `light-dark()` function for automatic color scheme switching:
- `color-scheme: light dark` enables auto detection
- All theme colors automatically adapt
- Shadows become deeper in dark mode

### CSS Scroll-Snap Layouts
Carousel and reel use native CSS scroll-snap for smooth scrolling:
- No JavaScript required
- Native browser performance
- Touch/trackpad/mouse wheel support
- Accessibility keyboard navigation

### Logical Properties
Framework uses logical properties throughout for RTL/LTR support:
- `inset-block-start` instead of `top`
- `margin-inline-start` instead of `margin-left`
- `padding-block` instead of `padding-top/bottom`
- Full bidirectional text support

### Layout Philosophy
- Mobile-first responsive design
- CSS Grid-based layouts
- CSS scroll-snap for carousels and reels
- Customize via CSS variables (--gap, --min-card-width, etc.)
- Minimal, composable classes
- No JavaScript dependencies

## Browser Support

Graffiti requires modern browsers for full functionality:

**Minimum versions:**
- Chrome 123+ (March 2024)
- Safari 17.5+ (May 2024)
- Firefox 128+ (July 2024)
- Edge 123+ (March 2024)

**Critical features:**
- OKLCH color space: Chrome 111+, Safari 15.4+, Firefox 113+
- Relative color syntax: Chrome 119+, Safari 16.4+, Firefox 128+
- `light-dark()` function: Chrome 123+, Safari 17.5+, Firefox 120+
- Container queries: Chrome 105+, Safari 16.0+, Firefox 110+
- `linear()` easing: Chrome 113+, Safari 17.2+, Firefox 112+
- Logical properties: Chrome 89+, Safari 15+, Firefox 66+
- CSS scroll-snap: Chrome 69+, Safari 11+, Firefox 68+

**Graceful degradation:**
Use `@supports` queries for progressive enhancement:
```css
@supports (color: oklch(0.5 0.2 180)) {
  /* OKLCH styles */
}
```
